Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple WebServer listening on the given port and serves the given directory. Resources are gzip compressed. If Mime type cannot be guessed, gzip will be used as fallback format. * @author Oguzhan Yigit * @email yigit@adobe.com * @version 0.1

      • parsePath

        Parses the path, the second argument in the HTTP request.

        Returns:
        The path to be queried.

      • exploreDirectoryOrFile

        private void exploreDirectoryOrFile(java.lang.String requestedPath)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Explores a directory or a file. If it turns out as a directory, return a list of all files and directories within that directory. If it turns out as a file return the file by guessing its Mime type in a gzipped way. If the Mime type cannot be determined, fall back to gzip.
        Parameters:
        requestedPath - The path we look at.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case the requester drops the connection.

      • parseHttp

        private void parseHttp()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the HTTP Request and calls the methods to query the directory or file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Sets the path and runs the server under the given port.
        Parameters:
        args - Java convention.
